Package mining

Class ClusterSet

java.lang.Object
mining.ClusterSet
All Implemented Interfaces:
Serializable
public class ClusterSet extends Object implements Serializable
The ClusterSet class represents a set of clusters (determined by k-means) and provides methods for initializing centroids, finding the nearest cluster to a given tuple, updating centroids, and generating string representations of the clusters.
See Also:

  • Constructor Details

    • ClusterSet

      public ClusterSet(int k)
      The constructor of the 'ClusteSet' class. Initialise a new 'ClusterSet' object with an array of 'k' 'Cluster' objects and sets the 'i' variable, which correspond to the length, to 0.
      Parameters:
      k - integer representing the number of cluster to be added.

  • Method Details

    • add

      public void add(Cluster c)
      The function adds a Cluster object to an array of Cluster objects.
      Parameters:
      c - The parameter "c" is an object of the class "Cluster" that has to be added into our array of objects of the class "Cluster" called "C". The index "i" is incremented after adding the object 'c'.

    • get

      public Cluster get(int i)
      The function returns the Cluster object at the specified index.
      Parameters:
      i - The parameter "i" is an integer representing the index of the cluster to be retrieved from an array or list of clusters.
      Returns:
      The method 'get' is returning a 'Cluster' object at the index 'i' from an array 'C'.

    • initializeCentroids

      public void initializeCentroids(Data data) throws OutOfRangeSampleSize
      This function initializes the centroids of a clustering algorithm using a random sampling method of the data.
      Parameters:
      data - The data parameter is an object of the Data class, which contains the data list of examples that we want to cluster.
      Throws:
      OutOfRangeSampleSize

    • nearestCluster

      public Cluster nearestCluster(Tuple tuple)
      The function finds the nearest cluster to a given tuple based on the distance between the tuple and the centroids of the clusters.
      Parameters:
      tuple - The parameter "tuple" is a data exmple or tuple that needs to be assigned to the nearest cluster based on the distance between the tuple and the centroids of the clusters.
      Returns:
      The method is returning the closer cluster to a given tuple.

    • currentCluster

      public Cluster currentCluster(int id)
      The function returns the cluster that contains a given ID or null if it is not found.
      Parameters:
      id - The parameter "id" is an integer representing the index of a data example that we want to find the cluster for.
      Returns:
      The method 'currentCluster' returns a 'Cluster' object that contains the given 'id'. If no such cluster is found, it returns 'null'.

    • updateCentroids

      public void updateCentroids(Data data)
      This function calculates the new centroid foreach clusterin.
      Parameters:
      data - list that contains the data examples that are being used to compute the centroids.
